intro: Sarcostemma madagascariense, commonly known as the Madagascar star vine, is a climbing plant native to Madagascar. It belongs to the family Asclepiadaceae and is characterized by its twining stems and showy, fragrant flowers. The plant produces distinctive, star-shaped flowers that are typically yellow or orange in color. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and often have a hairy texture. Sarcostemma madagascariense is adapted to grow in dry, rocky environments and is often found in forested areas.
